content: **temperature blanket ** this temperature blanket is knit in garter stitch in three panels that are seamed together select 10 - 25 colors of worsted #4 weight yarn to represent the daily temperature for your location for one calendar year decide on 5° or 10° temperature increments and assign one yarn color to each temperature category i used 14 colors of berroco vintage worsted #4 weight yarn to represent the daily high temperature for one calendar year **knit in three panels ** each blanket panel is about 15 wide the first panel on the left represents the first four months of the year the center panel represents early may through september 1st and the third panel on the right represents the last four months of the year ending at the bottom right corner with december 31st **more info ** please see detailed information on planning a temperature blanket on ** fiftyfourtenstudio com 1 ** get details on things to consider when selecting yarn yarn options ideas for selecting yarn colors a free printable pdf yarn color card how to track temperature data project photos and much more > buy 3 or more of my knitting patterns on ravelry 2 at the same time and receive 15% off your order no coupon code use add to cart and discount will automatically be applied when 3 or more patterns are in the cart offer cannot be applied to prior purchases **finished size ** approximately 45 wide x 58 long - the perfect size for a large cozy afghan one of the things i noticed when researching temperature blanket knitting projects is that knitters often end up with an extremely large blanket perhaps much larger than they anticipated when starting the project knitting the blanket in three panels makes a manageable usable size temperature blanket **yarn ** #4 worsted weight yarn in assorted colors i used berroco vintage worsted yarn in black cherry pumpkin marmalade butternut rye smoke overcast sage twilight breezeway jalapeno acai douglas fir and charcoal **yardage ** at least 2 900 3 100 yards of worsted weight yarn in an assortment of 10 - 25 yarn colors **for more details about yardage and yarn suggestions** ** see my blog post about planning a temperature blanket project 3 ** **gauge ** garter stitch with us size 8 needles 18 sts & 34 row 17 garter ridges = 4 take time to check gauge by casting on 25 - 30 stitches and knit every row garter stitch for 5 exact gauge is not essential select needle size that gives best appearance for your choice of yarn and your knitting gauge a different gauge may require more or less yarn and impact the finished size **skill level ** easy this pattern is easy to knit the pattern uses only knit stitches you will need to know how to cast on stitches knit confidently read a knitting pattern bind off stitches and weave in ends the pattern includes details about seaming the blanket panels
